common_errors.solution: List interfaces: networkctl list. Use correct interface name (eth0, enp0s3, etc.).
Start service: sudo systemctl start systemd-networkd
Use sudo for configuration changes: sudo networkctl reconfigure eth0

common_errors.cause: Interface managed by NetworkManager or other tool, not systemd-networkd
common_errors.solution: Either switch to networkd or use appropriate tool (nmcli for NetworkManager).

common_errors.cause: Attempted change not allowed (interface in use, wrong state)
common_errors.solution: Check interface state. May need to bring interface down first.

common_errors.cause: Network is up but some configuration failed
common_errors.solution: Check status details: networkctl status. Look at logs: journalctl -u systemd-networkd

common_errors.cause: Physical link not detected (cable unplugged, no WiFi association)
common_errors.solution: Check physical connection. For WiFi, associate with network first.

common_errors.cause: Interface has no route to reach other networks
common_errors.solution: Check .network file has [Route] or Gateway configured.

common_errors.cause: No DNS servers configured for this interface
common_errors.solution: Add DNS in .network file: DNS=8.8.8.8 or check DHCP is providing DNS.
Check configuration: journalctl -u systemd-networkd. Validate .network file syntax.
